sentences.english: We all need to use money but we need to be careful that we don't become tainted by it.
sentences.chinese: 我們都需要錢，但要小心不要因此而財迷心竅。

sentences.english: The poor man wants much,the miser everything.
sentences.chinese: 窮人要求多，財迷則樣樣都要。

sentences.english: The poor man wants much, the miser everything.
sentences.chinese: 貧平易近要求多，財迷則樣樣都要。

sentences.english: China was regarded by some foreign media as the top country obsessed with wealth.
sentences.chinese: 連老外都說咱中國人是超級財迷。

sentences.english: E. g. : Lisa is really monday hungry, who cares nothing but her wages.
sentences.chinese: 莉薩真是財迷心竅，一心只關心她工資。

sentences.english: I went to dinner with an older man who happened to make considerably more money than I did.
sentences.chinese: 我和一位年長的男人喫飯，他碰巧比我更財迷。

sentences.english: Everything in our sight turns into the gold ingots.
sentences.chinese: 眼裏看到的，什麼都象元寶，真是個財迷心竅的民族。

sentences.english: Gordon:I have changed, I am not so greedy anymore.
sentences.chinese: 我現在改了，不再那麼財迷了。

definition: to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to be generous (idiom)/to be magnanimous/Give me a break!
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to display one's slight skill before an expert (idiom)
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
(idiom) with everyone lending a hand (eagerly but somewhat chaotically)
